description: From Middle French discernable; spelling changed from -a- to -i- in the 17th century to conform to Latin discernibilis. Synchronically analyzable as discern +â€Ž -ible.

adjectives.description: discernible (comparative more discernible, superlative most discernible)

entries.meaning: Possible to discern; detectable or derivable by use of the senses or the intellect.
examples: There is a discernible performance difference between a Porsche and a Civic.
